head.title: Coronavirus - Hancock Place School District

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

a.title: Go to Hancock Place School District
Go to Hancock Early Childhood Center
Go to Hancock Parents As Teachers

div.h1:
Hancock Place School District
Inspiring Excellence

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

span.strong: an emerging and rapidly evolving outbreak of respiratory disease caused by a novel (new) coronavirus that was first detected in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China, and which has now been detected in many locations internationally, including cases in the United States. The virus has been named “SARS-CoV-2,” and the disease it causes has been named “coronavirus disease 2019” (abbreviated “COVID-19”).

div.h2: How will HPSD communicate with families with updates?

p.strong: We will notify families when necessary through our regular communication channels.

div.h2: How can I get breakfast and lunch for my family?

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;;font-size: 13px;

p.span: Breakfast & lunch will be available 11-12 Monday to Friday for those 18 and under at five Lemay locations: Hancock Place Middle School, Hancock Place Central Office, Schnucks, Cusanellis, and Sam’s Convenience Market

div.h2: What should I do if my kid is sick? Is the Hancock Health Clinic Open.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The Hancock Clinic is open for regular hours but you MUST call ahead for appointments to be made. No walk-ins during this time! Please call to make an appointment at 544-1300 X189

div.h2: My child is stressed out from all of the news & media. What can I do to help them?

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;;font-size: 13px;

p.span: We have therapeutic counselors available through Presbyterian Children’s Homes & Services and Preferred Family Healthcare to speak with your children. Contact our helpline at: 544-1300 X219 or email us at Covidhelp@hancock.k12.mo.us and we will get back with you as soon as possible.

div.h2: How can I stay updated on all of the information associated with Covid-19?

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: The most updated information can be found at

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

div.h2: What if someone in my household needs to be tested for the virus? What do I do?

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;;font-size: 13px;

p.span: Contact the County Health Hotline at 314-615-2660

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;;font-size: 13px;

div.h2: What if my child is signed up to receive weekender bags?

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;;font-size: 13px;

p.span: They will continue to get delivered as long as there are no restrictions on us doing so.

div.h2: What if I need to speak to a police officer?

span.style: font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;;font-size: 13px;

p.span: School Resource Officer Willenbrock is available to our families, as needed. Call the helpline at 544-1300 X219 or email at Covidhelp@hancock.k12.mo.us if you have specific questions for her.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

div.h2: Where can I turn for more information?

p.style: margin: 0px; color: rgb(76, 76, 76); font-family: Raleway, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;

a.style: cursor: pointer; text-decoration-line: none; outline: transparent; animation: 0.7s ease 0s 1 normal forwards running csAnimateFocus; color: rgb(204, 32, 41); opacity: 1 !important; transition: none 0s ease 0s !important;

p.style: margin: 0px; color: rgb(76, 76, 76); font-family: Raleway, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;
margin: 0px; color: rgb(76, 76, 76); font-family: Raleway, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;
p.strong:
314.615.2660
Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services Hotline 24/7
877-435-8411
Center for Disease Control and Prevention
World Health Organization

br.a: Special School District (SSD) Director Letter to Partner District Parents (1).pdf

div.p: Hancock Place School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. Hancock Place School District also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
